title: About me
text:
A native of Grand Rapids, I graduated from Calvin University in 2017 with a BS in Biology.

I followed my passion for infection prevention to the University of Michigan School of Public Health, where I completed an MPH in Hospital & Molecular Epidemiology in 2020.

There, I worked for Dr.¬†Lona Mody, of the Division of Geriatric & Palliative Medicine, studying antibiotic-resistant bacteria and infection prevention in hospitals and nursing homes.¬†

Currently, I am in my 5th year of a PhD in Microbiology & Immunology. I work with Dr.¬†Evan Snitkin to leverage clinical metadata and whole-genome sequencing to study the evolution and spread of carbapenem-resistant Enterobacterales in hospital and community settings.

title: About me
text:
Research interests
My career goal is to develop innovative solutions to combat antibiotic resistance by combining advanced genomic approaches, data analysis, and wet lab experimentation to identify patient and bacterial features that drive the emergence and spread of antibiotic resistance. ‚Äã


My interests:

Evolution of antibiotic resistance
Transmission of antibiotic-resistant organisms
Phylogenetics of bacterial genome-influenced traits
Translational infection prevention research¬†


Methods of interest:

Whole-genome sequencing
Epidemiological study designs
Statistical genomics
Experimental validation of genomic observations

title: Research
text:
My research leverages clinical metadata and whole-genome sequencing to study the evolution and spread of antibiotic resistant bacteria.
For the complete list of my publications, please visit my Google Scholar profile.

Microbial evolution
I leverage whole-genome sequencing data, phylogenetics, and epidemiological methods to evaluate the evolution of bacterial pathogens. Primarily focusing on the evolution of antibiotic resistance, I am also interested in the genomic drivers of bacterial infections.

Gontjes K, Singh A, Sansom SE, Boyko J, Smith SA, Lautenbach E, Snitkin E. Phylogenetic context of antibiotic resistance provides insights into the dynamics of resistance emergence and spread. medRxiv. link
Unverdorben LV, Pirani A, Gontjes K, Moricz B, Holmes CH, Snitkin ES, Bachman MA. Klebsiella pneumoniae evolution in the gut leads to spontaneous capsule loss and decreased virulence potential. mBio, March 2025. link



Microbial genomic epidemiology
I leverage observational and intervention studies to evaluate the distribution and determinants of colonization and infection with antibiotic-resistant organisms. Alongside descriptive analyses, I develop novel research methodologies and translational infection prevention research.

Lapp Z, ‚Ä¶ Gontjes K, ‚Ä¶, Evan Snitkin, Rachel B Slayton. Distinct Origins and Transmission Pathways of blaKPC Enterobacterales across Three U.S. States. J Clin Microbiol. August 2023. link
Zhang HL, Gontjes K, Han JH, Alby K, Lapp Z, Snitkin S, Goldstein EJC, Muldoon S, Tolomeo P, Lautenbach E. Resistance phenotypes of carbapenem-resistant Klebsiella pneumoniae in a multi-state network of long-term acute care hospitals. Infect Control Hosp Epidemiol. June 2022. link



Translational infection prevention research
Alongside my research on the genomic epidemiology of antibiotic-resistance organisms, I have also conducted translational infection prevention research on the epidemiology of colonization with pathogenic bacteria.

Gontjes K, Gibson KE, Lansing B, Karen J, Cassone M, Wang J, Mills J, Mody L, Patel K. Association of exposure to high-risk antibiotics in acute care hospitals with multidrug-resistant organism burden in nursing homes. JAMA Network Open, February 2022. link
Mody L, Gontjes K, Cassone M, Gibson KE, Lansing B, Mantey J, Kabeto M, Galecki A, Min L. Effectiveness of a Multicomponent Intervention to Reduce Multidrug-Resistant Organisms in Nursing Homes: A Cluster Randomized Clinical Trial. JAMA Network Open, July 2021. link
Gontjes K, Gibson KE, Lansing B, Mody L, Cassone M. Can alternative anatomical sites and environmental surveillance replace perianal screening for multidrug-resistant organisms in nursing homes? Infect Control Hosp Epidemiol, March 2021. link
Gontjes K, Gibson KE, Lansing B, Mody L, Cassone M. Assessment of Race and Sex as Risk Factors for Colonization with Multidrug-Resistant Organisms in Six Nursing Homes. Infect Control Hosp Epidemiol, June 2020. link
Gontjes K, Gibson KE, Lansing B, Cassone M, Mody L. Contamination of Common Area and Rehabilitation Gym Environment with Multidrug-Resistant Organisms. J Am Geriatric Soc., December 2019. link



Cultural commentaries
I also enjoy writing about a variety of topics. I‚Äôve published commentaries on health education and the role of grace in medicine. Feel free to reach out if you‚Äôd like to discuss these subjects or collaborate on a commentary.

Gontjes K, Collier K. From a Culture of Blame to a Culture of Grace: A Letter in Reply to Papadakis. Infect Control Hosp Epidemiol, August 2021. link

title: Welcome!
text:
I‚Äôm Kyle Gontjes, a fifth-year PhD candidate in Microbiology & Immunology at the University of Michigan.
My research integrates clinical metadata and whole-genome sequencing to investigate the evolution and transmission of carbapenem-resistant Enterobacterales in complex populations, including those in long-term acute care hospitals and household settings.
I conduct my research in the Snitkin Lab, where we focus on microbial genomics and molecular epidemiology.


I plan to finish my PhD in Summer 2026 and am open to postdoctoral or research scientist roles in genomic epidemiology. Please feel free to reach out if you‚Äôd like to connect.
Explore my research, publications, tools, and CV to learn more.

title: Software
text:
I‚Äôve developed several open-source tools to support genomic epidemiology and microbial genomics research. These tools aim to simplify common workflows and analyses in bacterial genomics.
For more details and to explore the code, visit my Github profile

title: Software
text:
GeneScreener
A Snakemake pipeline that automates running BLAST searches across many genomes, making gene screening scalable and reproducible. Repository

title: Software
text:
ISScreener
Workflow designed to detect insertion sequences (IS elements) from Illumina whole-genome sequencing data, helping characterize mobile genetic elements. Repository

title: Software
text:
CoverageStats
Calculates coverage statistics for short-read sequencing data mapped to reference genomes, useful for quality control and comparative analyses. Repository

title: Software
text:
Phylokit
A Snakemake pipeline that generates phylogenetic trees from sequence alignments, streamlining evolutionary analysis workflows. Repository

title: Software
text:
Fastools
A collection of handy scripts for manipulating FASTA files, simplifying common sequence processing tasks. Repository

title: Software
text:
PhyloAMR
An R package that provides tools for phylogenetically informed analysis of antibiotic resistance and other genome-associated traits, integrating evolutionary context into genomic analyses. Repository
